item.title: Swedish envoy in Dhaka on four-day rights mission
item.description: Sweden’s Ambassador for Human Rights, Democracy and Rule of Law, Irina Schoulgin-Nyoni, is now on a four-day visit to Bangladesh, focusing on key human rights. issues, including the rights and empowerment of women and girls, freedom of expression and media freedom, and the role of civil soci

item.title: Police hunt for ‘Awami League activists’ in Dhaka hotels, arrest 44
item.description: Police have beefed up security in Dhaka ahead of the banned Awami League’s announced programme on November 13. Law enforcers have conducted overnight raids in different hotels and shared accommodations as Awami League leaders and activists head to the capital for the protest. On Tuesday, the

item.title: EU delegation chief Miller meets BNP’s Fakhrul
item.description: Michael Miller, ambassador and head of the European Union Delegation to Bangladesh, held a courtesy meeting with BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir on Wednesday. The meeting was held at the BNP chairperson’s office in Dhaka’s Gulshan at 11:00 am today, reports bdnews24.c

item.title: Grameen Bank branch set on fire in Brahmanbaria
item.description: Unidentified miscreants set fire to a Grameen Bank branch in Vijaynagar upazila of Brahmanbaria on Wednesday. The incident occurred around 2:00 am at the bank’s Chandura branch in the upazila. Bank Manager Md Kalim Uddin said the attackers poured petrol inside the office before setting it o

item.title: Police vehicle burns in Dhaka’s Ramna, microbus catches fire in Uttara
item.description: A police pickup van has caught on fire in front of the Ramna Police Station in Dhaka’s Kakrail while a fire was sparked on a microbus in the capital’s Uttara. Both incidents occurred due to mechanical problems, according to the police and the Fire Service. No one was hurt in either inc

item.title: Jet Crash: Two more Milestone students return home after 114 days
item.description: Two more students of Milestone School and College have returned home after 114 days of treatment for burn injuries sustained in the tragic Air Force plane crash in Uttara of Dhaka. The returnees are Saiba Jahan Saima, 10, and Saira Jahan, 10, students of class IV, UNB reports. On Wednesday mornin

item.title: Bus set ablaze in Kishoreganj
item.description: Unidentified miscreants set fire to a parked bus of Tisha Paribahan at Bajitpur Bus Stand in Kishoreganj district early Wednesday. The incident occurred around 1:00 am at the bus stand on the Bajitpur-Dhaka highway, confirmed Bajitpur Upazila Nirbahi Officer Shahidul Islam Sohan. He said the atta

item.title: Petrol bombs thrown at Mohammadpur Preparatory School overnight
item.description: Assailants have reportedly conducted a petrol bomb attack on Preparatory School and College located on Iqbal Road in Dhaka’s Mohammadpur. The incident occurred on Tuesday night, three days after an explosive device went off near the entrance of St Joseph School, not far from the institution,

item.title: 469 killed in 469 road accidents in October
item.description: A total of 469 people were killed and 1280 others injured in October in 469 road accidents, according to a BJKS (Bangladesh Jatri Kalyan Samiti) press release on Wednesday. Meanwhile, 52 accidents on the railways resulted in 47 deaths and 30 injuries. Besides, 12 people died and 1 went missing in

item.title: ‘Chhatra League’ locks five buildings at DU
item.description: Five academic buildings’ gates of Dhaka University were found locked early Wednesday night. Later, Leaders of the banned organisation, Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) admitted on Facebook to locking the gates. After this incident, five security guards ofthe university, assigned to the

item.title: Shatabdi Paribahan bus set on fire in Mirpur
item.description: Unidentified miscreants set fire to a Shatabdi Paribahan bus in front of Sony Cinema Hall at Mirpur-1 in Dhaka on Wednesday afternoon, police said. Ripon, duty officer at Shah Ali Police Station, said the incident took place around 12:30 pm when several individuals on motorcycles arrived and set t

item.title: Man shot dead in Badda
item.description: A man has been shot dead in the Badda area of Dhaka. The incident occurred around 3:30 am on Wednesday in Badda’s Chairman Goli, said local police station chief Habibur Rahman. “Unidentified assailants shot and killed Mamun Shikdar, aged 38,” he said. Habibur said Mamun worked
